function: Render interactive data visualization components for basketball analytics including line charts, bar graphs, and heatmaps.
static_description: A dashboard page with multiple chart containers arranged in a grid layout. Background color set to ghost white, component areas use slate gray styling. Charts are initially empty placeholders labeled 'Loading...' until populated via API.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on individual chart toggles between expanded view and normal size within the grid.
Hovering over data points displays tooltips showing detailed statistical values such as player efficiency rating or team win probability.

resource_dependency.postgresqlSchemaDefinition: CREATE TABLE matches (match_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, date TIMESTAMP, home_team_id INT, away_team_id INT, score_home INT, score_away INT); CREATE TABLE teams (team_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), wins INT, losses INT); CREATE TABLE players (player_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), team_id INT, ppg FLOAT, rpg FLOAT, apg FLOAT);

function: Establish connection to PostgreSQL database and define tables for storing basketball-related data including matches, teams, and players.
static_description: No visible UI element. Backend service initializes at startup using provided environment variables to connect to PostgreSQL instance and executes schema creation SQL commands if tables do not exist.

function: Ensure all frontend components retrieve dynamic content exclusively through backend RESTful API calls without any hardcoded fallbacks.
static_description: All data-displaying sections show loading indicators before rendering fetched data. Error messages appear when API responses fail or timeout.

interaction_and_states.description: Upon load, frontend makes concurrent GET requests to various /api/v1/* endpoints to populate visualizations and listings dynamically.

resource_dependency.matchHistoryTableSchema: Fields: match_id, date, home_team, away_team, result

function: Allow users to browse historical basketball match records sorted chronologically.
static_description: Dedicated Match History page displaying a paginated table listing past games. Columns include Date, Teams, Final Score, and Result. Default sort is descending by date. Table uses slate gray headers against ghost white background.

interaction_and_states.description: Infinite scroll loads additional pages of match history automatically upon reaching bottom of current list.
Clicking column headers sorts the table ascending/descending based on selected field.

function: Display current team standings along with relevant performance metrics updated regularly.
static_description: Standings page shows ranked teams in vertical list or grouped cards. Each entry includes team logo, name, win-loss record, and ranking position. Visual accents highlight top-tier performers.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a team card navigates to that team’s dedicated stats profile page.

function: Enable tracking and viewing of individual player performance statistics over time.
static_description: Player Performance section presents sortable roster lists per team. Individual entries show headshots, names, jersey numbers, and key stat averages displayed in tabular form using slate gray rows.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a player row redirects to their full-profile page featuring career timeline and advanced metric breakdowns.
Mouse-over highlights player’s season progression trendline embedded beneath basic stats.

resource_dependency.algorithmDetails: Machine learning model trained on historical game outcomes and team/player form factors.

function: Provide predictive insights about upcoming or ongoing match results derived from algorithmic analysis.
static_description: Prediction Results panel integrated into match detail views. Displays predicted winner, estimated margin of victory, and confidence level indicator icons aligned left beside outcome summary text.

interaction_and_states.description: Tapping 'View Details' reveals underlying data inputs used by prediction engine including recent form ratings and injury reports.

resource_dependency.oddsDataProviderIntegration: Requires third-party sportsbook API access for live betting lines.

function: Generate actionable betting suggestions backed by analytical models and market odds comparison.
static_description: Betting Recommendations module appears as filtered feed under Predictions tab. Entries contain recommended bet type, suggested stake percentage, expected value ratio, and linked match context preview.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Place Bet' opens modal prompting user to select preferred bookmaker partner (if multiple configured) and redirects externally to place wager securely.

function: Apply consistent thematic coloring across entire site interface adhering to specified palette.
static_description: Entire application UI utilizes CSS variables setting base background to ghost white and primary interactive elements/components rendered in slate gray tone throughout navigation bars, buttons, panels, etc.

function: Integrate interactive graphing tools enabling deep exploration of basketball datasets via zoom, pan, selection filtering.
static_description: Data Visualization dashboard renders diverse statistical representations using Plotly.js. All charts feature axis labeling, legends, and hover-enabled tooltips presenting granular insight into plotted metrics.

interaction_and_states.description: Users can drag-and-drop axes labels to reassign which variables are represented visually (e.g., switch X-axis from dates to opponent strength).
Single click selects individual data series for highlighting while double-click resets selections and zoom levels.
Mouse wheel adjusts zoom depth on supported chart regions allowing closer inspection of clustered or extended datasets.

resource_dependency.postgresDatabaseSchemaSQL: See above CREATE TABLE statements for matches, teams, players
resource_dependency.indexDefinitions: CREATE INDEX idx_matches_date ON matches(date); CREATE INDEX idx_teams_name ON teams(name); CREATE INDEX idx_players_team ON players(team_id);

function: Define relational database structure capable of persisting comprehensive basketball analytics dataset efficiently.
static_description: PostgreSQL database instantiated with core tables for Matches, Teams, Players, plus supporting indexes ensuring performant query execution during reporting and lookup operations.

resource_dependency.responseFormatStandard: JSON { status: number, data: [...], message?: string }

function: Expose structured HTTP interfaces facilitating retrieval of essential basketball information categorized logically.
static_description: Backend exposes standardized REST routes returning well-formed JSON payloads containing requested entities like match logs, leaderboard standings, or athlete summaries ready for client consumption.

resource_dependency.dataRefreshScheduler: cron job or setInterval() triggering daily sync process
resource_dependency.externalDataSourceAPI: Third-party sports statistics provider requiring authentication token management
resource_dependency.syncLogTable: CREATE TABLE sync_logs(timestamp DATETIME, entity_type TEXT, success BOOLEAN, error_msg TEXT);

function: Implement automated synchronization mechanism keeping internal analytics store synchronized with latest external source feeds.
static_description: Background task periodically polls trusted external APIs to ingest fresh scores, rosters, injuries, and other evolving data points then updates local PostgreSQL accordingly. Sync activity logged internally for monitoring purposes.

resource_dependency.installAllScriptCommand: "install:all": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm install\" \"cd backend && npm install\""

function: Configure unified dependency installation command streamlining setup workflow for multi-package repository structure.
static_description: Root-level package.json contains install:all script definition leveraging concurrently utility to execute nested npm install processes simultaneously inside frontend and backend directories.

resource_dependency.devModeScriptCommand: "dev": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm run dev\" \"cd backend && npm run dev\""
resource_dependency.processManagerTool: Uses concurrently to orchestrate parallel development server instances

function: Facilitate simultaneous runtime execution of both frontend development server and backend API services locally during active coding sessions.
static_description: Root package.json defines dev script launching both client-side hot-reloading web server and Node.js-based backend API listener concurrently via shared terminal session managed by concurrently tool.
